trans-unit.source: Specifies that a SAML assertion is addressed to a particular audience.
The SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition class corresponds to the `<saml:AudienceRestrictionCondition>` XML element, which is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.

The SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition is one of several <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlConditions> that can be used to scope a SAML assertion Use the SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition class to specify a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion> is intended for a specific audience and that the issuing SAML authority does not warrant the SAML assertion for other audiences that receive the security token.

The claims for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens are expressed as part of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>, which can optionally have a set of conditions affect the validity of the assertion.
One of those conditions is a SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition, which specifies that the assertion is addressed to one or more specific audiences.
The issuing SAML authority cannot prevent an unintended recipient from taking action on the basis of the information provided in the SAML assertion.
However, the SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition class allows the SAML authority to state explicitly that no warranty is provided to such a party in a machine- and human-readable form.

To specify the set of intended audiences, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7BSystem.Uri%7D%29> constructor that accepts a set of audiences.
To get the set of intended audiences, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.Audiences%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition"></xref> class with the specified set of audiences a SAML assertion is intended for.
This constructor sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.Audiences%2A> property.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> of type <xref:System.Uri> that contain a set of intended audiences.
audiences is .
Gets the set of audiences a SAML assertion is intended for.

To set the Audiences property, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.%23ctor%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7BSystem.Uri%7D%29> constructor that accepts a set of audiences.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref:System.Uri> that contain a set of intended audiences.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.

To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Causes this instance to be read-only.
When the MakeReadOnly method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true`.
Reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" name="<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" href=""></xref> element from the specified XML reader.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader> to read the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" name="<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" href=""></xref> element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML assertion that are defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that reads the <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clause of the digital signature.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is .
-or- samlSerializer is .

The <xref uid="langword_csharp_<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" name="<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" href=""></xref> element has a child <xref uid="langword_csharp_<Audience>" name="<Audience>" href=""></xref> element does not have a value.
Writes the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" name="<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" href=""></xref> element into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> to write the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" name="<AudienceRestrictionCondition>" href=""></xref> element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in the SAML assertion that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing <xref uid="langword_csharp_KeyInfo" name="KeyInfo" href=""></xref> clauses.
writer is .
-or- samlSerializer is .
